column2: Responsibilities       The Scrum Master promotes and supports the agile process within and outside the squad. This includes:     Work with organizational resources outside the squad to help them interact effectively with the squad, remove impediments and protect them from organizational bureaucracy     The Scrum Master coaches the Agile squad and the product owner on the Agile process, such as writing useful user stories and managing the backlog     They foster a collaborative culture and ensure the squad regularly celebrates success     The scrum master acts as a servant leader to the squad, they are not the "boss?     For a newly formed squad the scrum master role may be a full time activity. As the squad matures the scrum master can start to contribute some time to squad deliveries     Manage blockers, obstacles and dependencies.     Bring together stakeholders for alignment meeting     Organize training     Report on squad improvements     Facilitate retrospective to improve squad dynamics     Facilitate creation and maintenance of squad artefacts such as backlog, definitions and norms etc.      Forecast the numbers of deliverables possible in an iteration, which is based on evidence and reliable source     Track and remove impediments and report on the progress to the team and leadership     Manage Scrum Team Information & Stakeholder Register: A list of the Scrum team members and stakeholders     Product Backlog: Manage Prioritized List of user stories (requirements) maintained by the Product Owner throughout the project     Sprint Backlog: Manage the list of the Product Backlog items that the team committed to do in the sprint containing the tasks, assignments, and the status of work.     Burn Charts: Generate Burndown charts showing the work completed (burnup) and the work left to do (burndown). Updated daily by the Scrum Master following the Daily Scrum     Manage Sprint Retrospective Log: The Scrum Master will use this template to track the results of the lessons learned at the end of each sprint (called the sprint retrospective).     Sprint Velocity Chart: Generate velocity charts showing the story points committed and completed for each sprint.      Impediments Log: Track impediments that need resolution     Qualifications   Minimum qualifications      B.E. Computer Science / MCA      Good understanding of software development lifecycle, waterfall and agile development principles     Minimum 5 years of experience working in a financial institution, technology firm or project management department of a mid to large size corporation     Background and knowledge of banking and/or digital products     Extraordinary judgment and composure in high - pressure situations     Excellent communication skills.     Meticulous attention to detail     Proficient in Microsoft tools: Excel, Visio, MS Projects, Powerpoint     Extensive hands - on experience with JIRA on agile projects     PMP certification preferred but not mandatory     CSM certification or Agile experience ( min 3 years       Preferred qualifications      Influence and leadership skills -  ability to drive results and take command in a meeting or mediate in contentious situations; ability to foster an environment that is promotes teamwork     Analytical and detail oriented -  makes an effort to and is capable of understanding the subject matter and situations pertaining to each project, process, issue, etc     Enthusiasm and curiosity -  shows enthusiasm and drive to learn and ask questions both indirectly and directly related to the project     Strategic thinker -  Ability to see things big picture and not just focus on the day - to - day tasks     Innovative -  Has shown ways that he/she has gone beyond status quo to find innovative solutions to solve problems or to improve processes        ",

Guiding the team on how to get the most out of self-organization.                     Guiding the team on self-organizing to fill in the intentional gaps left in the Agile/Scrum frameworks.                     Assessing the Scrum Maturity of the team and organization and coaching the team to higher levels of maturity, at a pace that is sustainable and comfortable for the team and organization.                     Removing impediments or guiding the team to remove impediments by finding the right personnel to remove the impediment.                     Building a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, retribution, or being judged, with an emphasis on healing and problem-solving.                     Facilitating getting the work done without coercion, assigning, or dictating the work.                     Facilitating discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution. Assisting with internal and external communication, improving transparency, and radiating information.                     Supporting and educating the Product Owner, especially on grooming and maintaining the product backlog.                     Providing all support to the team using a servant leadership style whenever possible and leading by example.                     Reporting out of JIRA/Azure DevOps for various sprint/burndown or release burndown charts and prepared executive report out of JIRA/Azure DevOps reports.                     Risk identifying and reporting, and resolution.                     Executive reporting                     Feedback on member performance.                               Required qualifications for this role:                               Experience in playing the Scrum Master role for at least 5 years for a software development team that was diligently applying Scrum principles, practices, and theory.                     Knowledge of other Agile approaches: XP, Kanban, Crystal, FDD, etc.                     Awareness and experience with widely successful Agile techniques: User Stories, ATDD, TDD, Continuous                       Integration, Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games.                       Applicable knowledge of the technologies used by the team.                     Experience in applying a wide variety of well-documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach (example: various Burndown technologies, many Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc.).                     Excellent communication and mentoring skills.                     BTech/MTech in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field or MCA.                             Required Software Development Experience.                         10+ Year of Total Experience in IT sector                     5+ years of experience playing the Scrum Master role for a software development team.                         Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), Certified Scrum Professional (CSP) or Certified Product Owner (CSPO)                         Technologies required: Any software development experience, preferred in product development. column2: Project Manager      Location     Chennai - New Delhi - Mumbai       Job Role     The job of a Project Manager(PM) is responsible for project activities including work estimation, planning, stakeholder management and project quality and should own partnership with cross - functional technology and to design teams to ensure consistent, beneficial client interaction and solution delivery. The PM should ensure that resources are leveraged appropriately. The PM will be responsible for the deliverables under the pre - sales activities as well.   The PM to work directly with the implementation team to ensure delivery and implementation of the automation solution and will work with the management and the pre - sales team to ensure quality output.       Skills and Experience Required         Experience in Design Implementation of Robotics Process Automation     5 years of professional experience on automation and/or integration projects     Good exposure to Business process Analysis and automation     A track record in training and mentoring individuals on development and delivery disciplines     The ability to methodically solve business and technical problems using innovative and well - planned approaches with well documented, supportable and extensible developments     Excellent leadership stakeholder management capabilities     Require ability to understand coding logic (added advantage)     Knowledge of scrum and agile methodology         Responsibilities         Team Management, process management and compliance with quality standards; ensuring project delivery within time, cost and quality specifications     Understanding complex business scenarios     Review solutions/architecture     Drive realization of the agreed requirement, Manage Global/Remote delivery and Operations     Understand customer requirements build solutions     Track and publish performance to target dates deliverables     Manage People Operations: Interviews, training, mentoring, operational activities, own and resolve cross - functional issues, internal stakeholder escalations     Oversee effort estimation/business case for new projects         02     RPA Developer             Location     Chennai - New Delhi - Mumbai       Job Role     The job of an RPA Developer is to automate processes using RPA technology. This individual will work closely with process experts, SME and client resources to analyze and design solutions based on business requirements. The RPA Developer will also develop, test and implement in - scope processes while communicating effectively with stakeholders. The successful candidate will be able to build high - quality, innovative and fully performing automation solutions in compliance with standards and technical design.       Skills and Experience Required         Experience with one or more RPA technologies (UiPath, AutomationAnywhere, BluePrism, etc.)     Experience in one or more software development technologies is a key asset, such as: .NET or VB. UiPath experience a plus     Good understanding and experience using Microsoft Office, including the ability to read Excel macros to translate them to RPA solutions and/or integrations     Experience in Agile Methodologies (added advantage)     Able to understand user/business requirements to complete robust technical solution     Able to break down development problems and estimate time for development tasks     Able to analyze business processes to suggest process improvements and develop RPA solutions around them     Recognizes collaborative behavior and participates in collaborative activities     Identifies opportunities for innovation and offers new ideas (thinks outside the box)     Adapts to new environments and changing requirements         Responsibilities         Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming     Deal with escalations and more complex work as well as changes across the practices     To double - hat as lead Bot Controller at times     To identify and share trends and best practices     Review current systems and present ideas for system improvements, including cost proposals     Prepare training manuals for users     Tailor and deploy tools, processes and metrics     Comply with project plans and standards     Stay up to date with the latest technologies     Prepared to reskill themselves regularly in order to learn new RPA tools     Might be trained on courses, either in house or externally         03     Business Analyst             Location     Chennai - New Delhi - Mumbai       Job Role     The job of a Business Analyst(BA) entails working with RPA development team, functional SMEs and key project stakeholders to communicate and formulate the business objectives, scope, feasibility, timelines, documentation and various business and IT related requirements for a project.   The BA will act as a vital link for collaboration between project stakeholders and technical configurators to communicate between each other their requirements and to ensure that the technical configuration meets the business requirements. The BA will also play the role of breaking down architectural and technical complexities in order for project stakeholders to understand requirements, impending issues and their successful resolution.       Skills and Experience Required         1 - 2 years of work experience in IT / Business / ERP project implementation     MBA / CA inter / BCA / MCom     Strong analytical, problem solving skills and communication     Ability to take business decisions     Prior development experience on any RPA tool (added advantage)     Written and verbal communication, including technical writing skills (added advantage)     Understanding of IT landscapes and architecture, systems engineering concepts, business process re - engineering and business automation     The ability to conduct cost/benefit analysis     Intermediate to strong knowledge in MS Excel, Word, Visio, Powerpoint     Require ability to understand coding logic (added advantage)     Knowledge of scrum and agile methodology (added advantage)         Responsibilities         Gather requirements, translating and simplifying the requirements to the developers     Work with the functional process SME to create, analyse and validate the business process     Prepare the feasibility report, business case, final solution with the technical architect with the process SME and to lead the development project     Prepare the entire project plan and rollout plan     Communicating the project update to the business team     Stay abreast of all the latest technologies     Conduct knowledge sharing and training sessions     Conducting UAT and validating the solution against the requirement     Ensure that the project is delivered successfully as per the customer's requirement

column2: Job Description:  Project Manager (Sign Industry) We are seeking an experienced Project Manager with a background in the sign industry to join our team. Our company specializes in providing innovative signage solutions across various industries including aerospace, financial, hospitality, healthcare, and retail.?We also computerized directory systems to feature wall sculptures or ADA signage for an entire office building, providing beautiful, high-quality signs is our passion. Responsibilities: Manage and oversee sign projects from conception to completion, ensuring adherence to client specifications and industry standards. Collaborate with clients and internal teams to understand project requirements and objectives within targeted industries. Develop project plans, budgets, and timelines to coordinate resources effectively and deliver projects on schedule. column2: Job Title:  Project Management Office (PMO) Manager  Department : Project Management Office  Location:  Ahmedabad  Position Type:  Full-Time  Experience:  10 to 15 Years Job  Summary:  As a Project Management Office (PMO) Manager in our IT organization, you will play a crucial role in ensuring effective project management and delivery across various initiatives. The PMO Manager will be responsible for establishing and maintaining project management standards, processes, and methodologies, as well as providing leadership and support to project teams. This role requires a strong understanding of project management principles, excellent communication skills, and the ability to collaborate with diverse teams.    Key Responsibilities:  PMO Governance:  Develop, implement, and maintain PMO policies, processes, and procedures to ensure consistency and efficiency in project management practices.  Establish and enforce project governance standards, ensuring compliance with organizational policies.  Project Planning and Execution:  Work closely with project managers to develop project plans, schedules, and budgets.  Monitor project execution against plans, identifying and addressing potential issues and risks.  Resource Management:  Collaborate with department heads to allocate resources efficiently and effectively.  Conduct capacity planning to ensure the organization has the necessary resources to meet project demands.  Performance Measurement and Reporting:  Define and implement key performance indicators (KPIs) for project performance evaluation.  Generate regular and ad-hoc reports to communicate project status, risks, and issues to stakeholders. Stakeholder Management: Foster strong relationships with stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and understanding of project objectives. Conduct regular stakeholder meetings to gather feedback and address concerns.  Quality Assurance:  Implement quality assurance processes to ensure that projects are delivered to meet or exceed customer expectations.  Conduct project audits to verify compliance with established standards. Continuous Improvement: Identify areas for improvement in project management processes and provide recommendations for enhancements.  Promote a culture of continuous improvement within the PMO and the broader organization.  Training and Development:  Provide training and guidance to project managers and team members on project management best practices.  Keep abreast of industry trends and best practices to ensure the PMO remains current and effective.  Qualifications:   Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is highly desirable.  Proven 10+ experience in project management, with a focus on IT projects. Strong knowledge of project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Waterfall, etc.).  Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.  Ability to analyze data and provide insights for decision-making. Proficiency in project management tools and software.

column2: Job Description :    The Information Security manager is in charge of the Information Security Management function,  providing line management,  leadership and strategic direction for the function and liaising closely with other managers.    The purpose of the Information Security Management function,  in turn,  is to bring the organization s information security risks under explicit management control through the Information Security Management System.    Responsibilities   Routine line management and leadership of staff within the Information Security Management function   Leadership and strategic direction for the function,  ranging from planning and budgeting to motivational and promotional activities expounding the value of information security   Liaison with and offers strategic direction to related governance functions (such as Physical Security/ Facilities,  Risk Management,  IT,  HR,  Legal and Compliance) plus senior and middle managers throughout the organization as necessary,  on information security matters such as routine security activities plus emerging security risks and control technologies   Recruitment,  leadership and direction for a loose network of information security ambassadors distributed throughout the organization   Leads the design,  implementation,  operation and maintenance of the Information Security Management System based on the ISO/ IEC 27000 series standards,  including certification against ISO/ IEC 27001 where applicable   Forms a centre of excellence for information security management,  for example offering internal management consultancy advice and practical assistance on information security risk and control matters throughout the organization and promoting the commercial advantages of managing information security risks more efficiently and effectively   Leads or commissions the preparation and authorizes the implementation of necessary information security policies,  standards,  procedures and guidelines,  in conjunction with the Security Committee    Leads the design and operation of related compliance monitoring and improvement activities to ensure compliance both with internal security policies etc. and applicable laws and regulations   Leads or commissions suitable information security awareness,  training and educational activities   Leads or commissions information security risk assessments and controls selection activities   Leads or commissions activities relating to contingency planning,  business continuity management and IT disaster recovery in conjunction with relevant functions and third parties   Competencies    At least 5 years of full- time work experience in information security management and/ or related functions (such as IT audit and IT Risk Management)    Information security management qualifications such as CISSP or CISM   Absolutely trustworthy with high standards of personal integrity (demonstrated by an unblemished career history,  complete lack of criminal convictions etc.),  and willing to undergo vetting and/ or personality assessments to verify this if necessary   Hands- on team leadership and management experience,  ideally coupled with suitable management qualifications such as an MBA   Typically a background in technical IT r les such as IT architecture,  development or operations,  with a clear and abiding interest in information security   Experience   4 to 6 Years

column1: Technical Project Manager - Azure Integration Services
column2: We are currently seeking an experienced IT Project Manager with a strong background in development or integration initiatives, particularly on Azure Cloud. This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team and contribute to our ongoing success in leveraging cutting-edge technology.  Job Description:  As an IT Project Manager specializing in Azure Cloud Integration, you will play a key role in driving the successful execution of development and integration projects within our organization. You will be responsible for overseeing the planning, implementation, and delivery of projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.  Responsibilities:   Lead the end-to-end management of development and integration projects, with a focus on Azure Cloud technologies.  Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables.  Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, resource requirements, and risk management strategies.  Coordinate project activities, allocate resources, and monitor progress to ensure timely delivery of milestones.  Identify and mitigate project risks and issues, implementing effective contingency plans as needed.  Communicate project status, updates, and key milestones to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.  Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance project management processes and practices.  Mentor and provide guidance to team members, fostering a culture of collaboration and accountability.  Qualifications:   Bachelors degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field.  Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT project management, with a focus on development or integration projects, preferably on Azure Cloud.  Proven track record of successfully delivering projects on Azure Cloud platform.  At least 3 years of experience specifically in running integration/develop projects, preferably on Azure.  PMP certification preferred, MS Azure certification highly preferred.  Strong knowledge of project management methodologies and tools, such as MS Project, Jira, Confluence, Analytics and Development, IAAS, Enterprise workload, or similar.  Experience working in Agile environments and familiarity with Agile methodologies.  Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.  Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.  If you are a results-oriented IT Project Manager with a passion for driving innovation and delivering value through Azure Cloud integration, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

column2: The role of a project manager is to serve as the middleman between the client and the internal team at Group 8A, making sure everything stays organized. It is the project managers role to be the advocate for both parties: the client should feel the project manager is fighting internally for the client and the internal team should feel the project manager is respecting them and pushing back on sometimes unnecessary tasks.      The goal of the project manager is essentially to keep the clients happy, while maintaining strong internal morale on the tasks required for the client. If everything goes well, the client should re-sign with Group 8A, the ultimate goal for the project manager. The project manager also will try to upsell clients on certain services that can help improve performance beyond the current scope of work.   Duties and Responsibilities      Researching clients to get a complete understanding of the company within its industry     Researching client competitors to round out the competitive landscape and industry picture     Creating an organization process to ensure all internal tasks are completed     Maintaining this organization to aid in client happiness and aim to defend against clients leaving company/Group 8A     Researching other aspects of the digital marketing ecosystem to provide knowledge that can be sent to the clients in an effort to show overall knowledge of the digital marketing word.     Etc.

providing meaningful feedback and effectively facilitate retrospectives to pull actionable changes for the team     Use empirical data to help the teams assess their Scrum Maturity and optimize velocity to attain organizational KPIs while also helping to identify improvement opportunities     Ensure the development teams practice core agile principles of collaboration, prioritization, team accountability and visibility and cross functional coordination (analysts, developers, and testers)     Work with Development managers to manage team capacity, with enterprise leadership to determine staffing requirements and assist with identifying resources to be procured from inside / outside the organization     Ensure scope, goals, milestones, budget, risk, status, change requests and critical issues are effectively communicated to the client and project/program team and assist in change management     Develop and maintain a productive working relationship with both internal and external team members including executive business owners, product managers and vendors     Conduct formal review with business sponsor at project completion to confirm acceptance and satisfaction to track and measure client satisfaction levels and make and implement recommendations           Preferred experience with managing eCommerce type agile development work and teams.                                                              What your background should look like                                                                    Educational Qualifications:            Education:      Bachelors degree in business, Management, Information Systems or Engineering        Certifications:      Scrum Master certification / CSP / PMI-ACP / Related certification required, Mandatory - SaFE Certification               Work Experience:        6 - 8 years of IT experience including prior Scrum Master experience               Skills and Knowledge:            Behavioral Skills:         Collaborative Approach   Strong Influencing Skills   Task Prioritization   Time Management   Strategic Thinking   Planning and Organizational Skills   Foster Positive Work Environment   Strong Communication and Presentation Skills   Analytical and Problem-solving skills   Ownership and Initiative - taking   KPI development and sprint performance monitoring   Negotiation Management   Mentorship Skills         Technical Skills:          Technical aptitude to work closely with software engineers   Competent understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC)   Thorough knowledge of both agile and waterfall methodologies on technically complex projects   Foundational understanding of Design Thinking, User Centered Design and Organizational Change Management (OCM) concepts         Tools Knowledge:         Working knowledge of Microsoft Applications including MS Office, MS Project, MS Visio   Knowledge of Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) e.g., Jira, Azure DevOps   Understanding of Project and Portfolio Management tools e.g., Clarity, Open Workbench

column2: Project Co-ordinator Quite a few companies these days have a separate position of a project co-ordinator - a person who handles the flow of a web site and who co-ordinates between the marketing and the development team. Ltd., the responsibility of a project co-ordinator includes completion of each and every project as per schedule (made by the Project Co-ordinator) and ensuring that all the entire project team of designers, copywriters and programmers deliver projects as and when planned. A project co-ordinator is usually a systematic and methodical person with good communication skills and managerial ability.

column2: Job Description: Summary : As a Implementation Consultant, you will be responsible for leading the implementation of PTC PDM / PLM software solutions from scratch and Integration to ERPs like Infor FP7 and SAP. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand the business requirements, configure the PDM / PLM software solutions to meet the needs, and provide guidance and support throughout the implementation process. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in PLM / PDM implementation, expertise in PTC Windchill, and excellent communication and problem-solving skills. Key Responsibilities:    Engagement : Engage with Stakeholders to understand the business requirements, processes, and objectives related to PLM implementation.   Solution Design : Design and configure PTC Windchill solutions to meet client requirements, including system setup, workflows, data management, and integration with other enterprise systems.   Implementation : Lead the implementation of Windchill PLM solutions, including installation, configuration, customization, and testing.   Training : Provide training and support to client teams on Windchill functionality, best practices, and usage.   Documentation : Prepare detailed documentation of system configurations, workflows, and other implementation-related activities.   Project Management : Manage project timelines, resources, and deliverables to ensure successful and timely implementation of Windchill solutions.   Collaboration : Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software developers, engineers, and project managers, to deliver integrated solutions that meet client needs.   Support : Provide ongoing support and maintenance for implemented Windchill systems, including troubleshooting, issue resolution, and system upgrades. Skills and Qualifications:   PTC PDM / PLM Platforms, Integration to ERPs like Infor FP7 and SAP.  Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering  Proven experience (10-15 years) in PLM implementation, with expertise in PTC Windchill.  Strong understanding of product development processes and industry best practices.  Proficiency in Windchill modules such as PDMLink, ProjectLink, Change Management, and Workflow.

of SAP solutions includes complete end-to-end implementations, point CIP solutions, technical upgrades and various module implementations     The candidate needs to have excellent communications skills and a strong desire to deliver results while managing multiple projects simultaneously     This is a hands-on project manager position and requires the incumbent to participate in and lead all phases of project ie design, development, implementation, deployment, and maintenance     In this role you report to the IT VP of Enterprise Support of Information Technologies and matrix report to the ERP 2.0 Program Leader         **Requirements:**         + 10 years experience as an Information Systems Manager, IT Project Manager, Application Developer, Systems Analyst, or in a related occupation     + 7 years of SAP ERP implementation experience of which 3 years should be in a manufacturing environment     + 3 full life cycle implementation experience from requirements to production support + 3 years experience as a hands-on ERP Project Manager     + Experience in SAP s project methodology     + Must be adept at communicating with non-technical shop floor business personnel     + 4-year degree in Information Systems, Business, Engineering or related discipline     + Excellent organization and communication skills     + Demonstrated ability to work in and manage matrix teams Must be able to proactively resolve issues and technical problems     + Must be Organized and have excellent communications skills     + Ability to coordinate multiple tasks at one time     + Excellent communication, organization, and presentation skills     + Has the ability to work in a cross-functional matrix environment     + Fluent in the English language both verbally and in writing     + Expert in Change Request Management, ideally SAP Solution Manager (CHARM Process)     + Proven knowledge and project experience in Release change / Upgrades / Enhancement Packages / SAP Notes         **Responsibilities:**         + Manage, deliver and support ERP implementations that identify, design, implement creative business solutions and technology solutions for Flowserve     + Manage implementation risk, manage project economics including planning and budgeting, define deliverable content, ensure buy-in of proposed solutions from top management levels at the business as well as IT governance and be accountable for execution      + Manage the day to day interactions with business management and sponsorship      + Manage and provide leadership to a team of multiple employees and consultants      + Coach, mentor, and supervise project team members and contractors, and influence them to take positive action and accountability for their assigned work      + Ensure end to end project governance and drive standardization in the processes to support, control and manage SAP in Flowserve as well as in the implementation methods that are used to roll out ERP       **Preferred qualifications :**        + Experience working as a business user      + Experience working in or supporting multiple ERPs      + Experience working in a multi-national and multi-cultural environment      + Previous management experience with proven record of leading or directing a team of IT resources     Experience in managing offshore teams is a preferred       **Additional information:**        Candidates will be required to travel as per business needs; travel is generally expected to be around 25-50% but can be more if the business situation demands

column2: Project manager (more than 7 years experience)    Qualifications Recruitment consultant roles are generally open to graduates regardless of degree subject. Employers typically value drive  , experience  , skills and abilities as well as the determination to succeed over specific qualifications. Applying to an agency that specialises in a market or industry related to your degree subject  , for example IT or engineering  , may increase your chances.    Entry with an HND or foundation degree is possible. Entry without a degree is possible for those with relevant experience  , skills and abilities.    Postgraduate study is not essential. You may find that relevant experience and skills are more useful. You must also enjoy working in a high    -    pressure environment and the responsibility that comes with it.   Work experience Work experience in sales  , marketing or any customer    -    oriented role is useful for starting a career in the recruitment industry. Recruitment consultancies will often accept applications from those without recruitment industry experience as long as they demonstrate the right combination of skills and personal qualities. column2: Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled Firmware Project Manager to lead a team of 8-12 individuals with varying levels of experience, ranging from fresh graduates to seasoned professionals with 20+ years in the technical field. This position requires exceptional people management abilities, coupled with a deep understanding of firmware development in a distributed global project environment. The specific focus of this role is on managing projects within firmware domain, operating within a C++/Linux environment. Responsibilities: Project Planning and Execution: Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of firmware projects within the Fax domain, ensuring alignment with project objectives, timelines, and budget constraints. Team Management: Manage a diverse team of firmware engineers, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to individuals with varying levels of experience. Foster a collaborative and inclusive team environment. Resource Allocation: Efficiently allocate resources within the team to maximize productivity and ensure project milestones are met. Stakeholder Communication: Act as the primary point of contact for internal and external stakeholders, providing regular updates on project progress, risks, and mitigation strategies. Risk Management: Identify potential risks and challenges associated with firmware development projects and implement proactive measures to mitigate them effectively. Quality Assurance: Implement robust quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability, performance, and security of firmware solutions developed by the team. Process Improvement: Continuously evaluate and improve firmware development processes, methodologies, and tools to enhance team efficiency and effectiveness. People Development: Develop and implement strategies for the professional growth and development of team members, including training programs, skills enhancement initiatives, and career progression opportunities. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, software developers, and quality assurance specialists, to achieve project objectives and deliver high-quality firmware solutions. Global Project Management: Manage projects in a distributed global environment, coordinating activities across multiple geographical locations and time zones. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred. Proven experience (minimum 5 years) in firmware development, with hands-on experience in C++ programming and Linux environment. Having exposure to Fax or Networking domain would be an added advantage Previous experience (minimum 3 years) in a project management or leadership role, in the technology industry. Strong leadership and people management skills, with the ability to inspire, motivate, and develop team members of diverse backgrounds and experience levels. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. Demonstrated ability to manage projects in a distributed global environment, with experience coordinating activities across multiple locations. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify issues, propose solutions, and drive resolution in a timely manner. Knowledge of firmware development best practices, industry standards, and quality assurance methodologies. Familiarity with Agile, SAFe or other iterative development methodologies is a plus. Shift - No shift premium (India)

column2: At IBM, our Project Managers excel by leading and coordinating a project team's overall performance, scope, cost, and deliverables. Our clients rely on timely and efficient status reports, and as Project Manager, you will drive the charge with project direction, metric definition, and performance management. If you are ready to help our clients and project teams succeed, we would love to meet you! Your Role and Responsibilities This role is responsible for leading a project team in delivering a solution to the client using the appropriate business measurements and terms and conditions for the project according to the project charter, project agreement or contract. They have overall performance responsibility for managing scope, cost, schedule, and contractual deliverables, which includes applying techniques for planning, tracking, change control, and risk management. They are responsible for managing all project resources, including subcontractors, and for establishing an effective communication plan with the project team and the client. They provide day to day direction to the project team and regular project status updates and requests for support to project stakeholders. Required Technical and Professional Expertise SAP Implementation and Configuration: A strong understanding of SAP modules and components, including SAP ERP, CRM, SCM, BW/BI, etc. Ability to lead and oversee SAP support projects. Project Management: Experience in managing SAP projects, including planning, scheduling and resource management. Knowledge of project management methodologies such as Agile or Waterfall. Team Leadership and Management: Ability to lead a team of SAP professionals, providing guidance, mentoring, and support. Experience in building and managing high-performing teams. Business Process Knowledge: In-depth understanding of business processes of electronics industries and how SAP solutions can be tailored to meet business requirements. Integration Skills: Understanding of how SAP systems integrate with other third-party systems and applications. Experience with middleware solutions like SAP PI/PO. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Client Management: Experience in managing relationships with client and partners. Negotiation skills for contracts and service level agreements. SAP Certifications: Certifications such as SAP Certified Application Associate or Professional can demonstrate a deep understanding of specific SAP modules. Analytics and Reporting: Familiarity with various reporting tools for management of project and understanding of project financials.

column2: Intellistride IoT business solutions are designed to be fully integrated offering our customer enhanced productivity, improved quality, efficient logistics processes and increased customer satisfaction.In order to ensure our customers are competitive, we accumulate Kathrein RFID expertise using the platform-independent SAP-certified software CrossTalk , created by our recently acquired company noFilis.      This enables us to use track and trace visualisation toseamlessly incorporate any identification technology - including open-standard options such as barcode readers and RFID labels - and generate interfaces with ERP and SCM systems.High-end hardware and customer-oriented service round off our portfolio. We provide RF simulation, application support, software integration and implementation as well as operation and maintenance - all from a single source     .The PositionIntellistride is looking for a Technical Project Manager to Execute IoT business in India market. Intellistride aims to provide end to end IoT Solutions to enterprises in the region.Technical Project Manager - IoT will have the responsibility of implementing and project managing solutions for Customers in India. Key priorities of the role will be as follows:Project Management IoT cases based on defined Solutions.      The Technical Project Manager works across Kathrein and non Kathrein RFID IoT product and services landscape and implements the solution on ground. The Solution could incorporate 3 rd Party products and devices which can be integrated onto Kathrein Cross talk IoT platform.Cost, Time and Quality management for the RFID/IoT projects: The Project Manager is responsible for managing the Project Cost , Time and Quality.      He is expected to manage the Risks for Project delivery and take adequate actions to mitigate the risks.Third party Partner Management : Technical Project Manager is expected to manage the third party suppliers and service providers contributing to the project.Understanding Customer Business needs: The position requires the person to understand current Customer processes and Business needs. The implemented solution should demonstrate considerable business improvement on financials and process efficiencies.     Documentation and Presentation to Customers:     ?The position requires the person to support the Management in Customer interface with presentation and Customer Project documentation. He will be required periodically to present the project progress to Management Leading/ Supporting POC/ Demo: The position will require supporting specificcustomer demo of Kathrein Products and running of Proof of Concept (POC) for solutions. The success criteria for the POC will need to be defined with the Customer.     Technical Project Manager will need to lead the technical changes that need to be done to make the POC a success.Interactions with Regional Solutions Team and Global Developmentteam: Technical Project manager will be responsible for working closely with Regional Solution Constant team in Bangalore India. The Technical Project Manager will be a member of this regional team for all technical development and Solution discussions.     The Technical Project Manager in the country is also expected to be working and providing inputs into global Developments of IoT Products. Partnerships and Vendor management and local testing: Kathrein philosophy is to incorporate devices from third party vendors onto the readers and Crosstalk software.This will require the Technical Project Manager to do local testing of tags, sensors and other devices and qualifying the quality of tags and devices including interworking with Kathrein platform.     Candidate requirements:      6-8 years of Strong Project management background in IoT/ RFID/ Software. Understanding of RF principles, networking and basics SW Application implementation. Good English speaking/ written communication absolutely critical as the candidate will be dealing with international customers and internal team. Good understanding of IoT Value chain, System Integration and Software Sales concepts. Deep HW SW technical and execution background in RFID,Sensors IoT Platform domain.      Capable of managing Project Management thru professional Project Management tools like MS Project etc. Good understanding of Customer Sales engagement process is essential. Experience on large complex IoT projects will be an added advantage. Additional business economics experience advantageous. Good market/ Competitive/ Partner knowledge in IoT space.      Open and free mind to determine and create solutions (technical creative person) Hands-on mentality Good office skills (PowerPoint, Excel, ...). Understanding of Crosstalk Software will be an advantage Experience in creating presentations and training schemes Preparedness to travel (within and outside India)

column2: Project Manager      Location     Chennai - New Delhi - Mumbai       Job Role     The job of a Project Manager(PM) is responsible for project activities including work estimation, planning, stakeholder management and project quality and should own partnership with cross - functional technology and to design teams to ensure consistent, beneficial client interaction and solution delivery. The PM should ensure that resources are leveraged appropriately. The PM will be responsible for the deliverables under the pre - sales activities as well.   The PM to work directly with the implementation team to ensure delivery and implementation of the automation solution and will work with the management and the pre - sales team to ensure quality output.       Skills and Experience Required         Experience in Design Implementation of Robotics Process Automation     5 years of professional experience on automation and/or integration projects     Good exposure to Business process Analysis and automation     A track record in training and mentoring individuals on development and delivery disciplines     The ability to methodically solve business and technical problems using innovative and well - planned approaches with well documented, supportable and extensible developments     Excellent leadership stakeholder management capabilities     Require ability to understand coding logic (added advantage)     Knowledge of scrum and agile methodology         Responsibilities         Team Management, process management and compliance with quality standards; ensuring project delivery within time, cost and quality specifications     Understanding complex business scenarios     Review solutions/architecture     Drive realization of the agreed requirement, Manage Global/Remote delivery and Operations     Understand customer requirements build solutions     Track and publish performance to target dates deliverables     Manage People Operations: Interviews, training, mentoring, operational activities, own and resolve cross - functional issues, internal stakeholder escalations     Oversee effort estimation/business case for new projects         02     RPA Developer             Location     Chennai - New Delhi - Mumbai       Job Role     The job of an RPA Developer is to automate processes using RPA technology. This individual will work closely with process experts, SME and client resources to analyze and design solutions based on business requirements. The RPA Developer will also develop, test and implement in - scope processes while communicating effectively with stakeholders. The successful candidate will be able to build high - quality, innovative and fully performing automation solutions in compliance with standards and technical design.       Skills and Experience Required         Experience with one or more RPA technologies (UiPath, AutomationAnywhere, BluePrism, etc.)     Experience in one or more software development technologies is a key asset, such as: .NET or VB. UiPath experience a plus     Good understanding and experience using Microsoft Office, including the ability to read Excel macros to translate them to RPA solutions and/or integrations     Experience in Agile Methodologies (added advantage)     Able to understand user/business requirements to complete robust technical solution     Able to break down development problems and estimate time for development tasks     Able to analyze business processes to suggest process improvements and develop RPA solutions around them     Recognizes collaborative behavior and participates in collaborative activities     Identifies opportunities for innovation and offers new ideas (thinks outside the box)     Adapts to new environments and changing requirements         Responsibilities         Prepares and installs solutions by determining and designing system specifications, standards, and programming     Deal with escalations and more complex work as well as changes across the practices     To double - hat as lead Bot Controller at times     To identify and share trends and best practices     Review current systems and present ideas for system improvements, including cost proposals     Prepare training manuals for users     Tailor and deploy tools, processes and metrics     Comply with project plans and standards     Stay up to date with the latest technologies     Prepared to reskill themselves regularly in order to learn new RPA tools     Might be trained on courses, either in house or externally         03     Business Analyst             Location     Chennai - New Delhi - Mumbai       Job Role     The job of a Business Analyst(BA) entails working with RPA development team, functional SMEs and key project stakeholders to communicate and formulate the business objectives, scope, feasibility, timelines, documentation and various business and IT related requirements for a project.   The BA will act as a vital link for collaboration between project stakeholders and technical configurators to communicate between each other their requirements and to ensure that the technical configuration meets the business requirements. The BA will also play the role of breaking down architectural and technical complexities in order for project stakeholders to understand requirements, impending issues and their successful resolution. column2: Job Summary:  We are looking for a Technical Project Manager who oversees end-to-end project delivery, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and scope. The person will be leading cross-functional teams, managing resources, mitigating risks, and maintaining strong communication with the clients. With a focus on quality assurance, the Technical Project Manager combines technical expertise with effective leadership to drive successful project outcomes. Roles & Responsibilities:  Ensure accuracy of team plans and consider dependencies between teams. Coordinate internal resources for project execution. Manage client relationships. Perform risk management to minimize project risks. Ensure timely, quality, and within-scope project delivery. Conduct capacity planning and forecasting based on resource availability and skillset. Alert the team on available resources and assign work for skill improvement. Manage changes to project scope and schedule. Measure project performance using appropriate tools. Utilize tools like JIRA, Confluence, TFS, Github, Basecamp. Attend daily scrum and provide weekly status updates to clients. Generate and review timesheets post-project completion. Review weekly time logs, issue warnings for discrepancies. Provide improvement points to HR for team members' performance enhancement. Prepare sprint lifecycle documents (sprint plan, user story, acceptance criteria, progress report, retrospective analysis). Monthly reporting of team productivity to the CEO. Key Competencies:  Effective communication with colleagues, clients, and stakeholders. Confidence to extract the best from the team and deliver quality for clients. Strong organizational skills with attention to detail, effective multitasking, and time management abilities for prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines across multiple projects. Knowledge of complete SDLC (software development life cycle). Strong problem-solving skills. Ability to quickly grasp technical concepts and develop the appropriate test approach. Experience in handling large/mid-size enterprise projects in web development/mobile development/designing/testing. Experience in working in an Agile environment. Hands-on experience with project communication tools (e.g., Basecamp or Trello) and project management tools like Jira, Azure DevOps. Analytical skills to find solutions to complex problems. Adaptability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies and tools. Collaboration skills, both as part of a team and in a leadership role. Attention to detail to ensure code quality and avoid bugs. Continuous learning mindset to stay up-to-date with industry trends. column2: Job Description: We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Project Manager to oversee Azure and tenant-to-tenant (T2T) migration projects. This role requires extensive expertise in Microsoft 365, Azure AD, and other cloud-based services, along with strong project management and leadership skills. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully managing complex migration projects, ensuring seamless transitions and modernization of applications and infrastructure. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Management: Develop comprehensive project plans outlining      the scope, objectives, timelines, resources, and risk management      strategies for tenant-to-tenant migration projects. Coordinate with stakeholders to define project      requirements, deliverables, and success criteria. Allocate resources, manage budgets, and track      project progress to ensure timely and within-budget delivery. Migration Execution: Lead the execution of tenant-to-tenant      migration projects, including data migration, user transition, and      configuration adjustments. Oversee the migration of email, data,      applications, and other resources between tenants while ensuring data      integrity and security. Implement best practices for minimizing      downtime and disruptions during the migration process. Plan and oversee the modernization of legacy      applications and systems, leveraging Azure PaaS and SaaS offerings to      enhance performance, scalability, and security. Lead the execution of migration projects,      including data migration, application re-hosting, re-platforming, and      re-architecting as needed. Stakeholder Communication and Management: Serve as the primary point of contact for all      project-related communications, including status updates, issue      resolution, and stakeholder feedback. Facilitate regular project meetings,      presentations, and reports to keep stakeholders informed and engaged. Manage expectations and address concerns from      clients and internal teams throughout the project lifecycle. Technical Expertise and Problem Solving: Utilize in-depth knowledge of Microsoft 365,      Azure AD, and other relevant technologies to troubleshoot and resolve      migration-related issues. Work closely with technical teams to ensure      that all technical aspects of the migration are addressed and optimized. Stay updated on the latest developments in      tenant migration tools, techniques, and best practices. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science,      Information Technology, or a related field. Relevant certifications (e.g., PMP, Microsoft      Certified: Azure Solutions Architect, Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise      Administrator Expert, Microsoft Certified: Azure DevOps Engineer) are      highly desirable. Minimum of 7 years of experience in project      management, with a focus on cloud-based services and migration projects. Excellent project management skills, including      planning, scheduling, resource allocation, and risk management. Strong leadership and team management      abilities, with a focus on collaboration and stakeholder engagement. Exceptional problem-solving and      troubleshooting skills, with the ability to handle complex technical      challenges. Excellent communication and interpersonal      skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical      stakeholders.

column2: We are looking for an experienced Project Manager/Team Leader to oversee the successful delivery of enterprise-level .NET projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in project management, coupled with sound knowledge of system design and setting up Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) frameworks. Responsibilities: Lead a team of developers and coordinate project activities to ensure timely and successful project delivery. Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders. Develop project plans, schedules, and budgets, and track progress against established milestones. Assign tasks and responsibilities to team members, and ensure adherence to project timelines and quality standards. Conduct regular project meetings to review progress, address issues, and communicate updates to stakeholders. Manage project risks and escalate issues as needed to ensure timely resolution. Foster a collaborative and positive team environment, providing guidance and support to team members as needed. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and implement best practices. Utilize sound system design principles to architect scalable and maintainable software solutions. Set up and manage CI/CD frameworks to automate build, test, and deployment processes, ensuring efficient and reliable software delivery. Requirements: Proven experience in project management, with a track record of successfully delivering enterprise-level .NET projects. Strong knowledge of system design principles and best practices. Experience in setting up and managing CI/CD frameworks for .NET projects. Excellent leadership and team management skills. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage with stakeholders at all levels. Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies. Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and adapt to changing priorities. Sound decision-making and problem-solving abilities. PMP or other relevant project management certifications are a plus. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your qualifications and relevant experience to hr@prescottinfosys.in. We look forward to reviewing your application!

column2: The Project Manager/Business Analyst is responsible for overseeing and managing projects within an organization, ensuring that they are delivered on time, within budget, and meet the business requirements      This role requires a combination of project management and business analysis skills, as the individual will be responsible for gathering and documenting business requirements, analyzing processes, and managing project timelines and resources              Key Responsibilities:      1. Project Management: (It Services/Web Development)        Plan, execute, and monitor projects from initiation to completion, ensuring adherence to project timelines, budgets, and quality standards.    Define project scope, objectives, deliverables, and success criteria in collaboration with stakeholders.    Identify and manage project risks, issues, and dependencies, implementing mitigation strategies as necessary.    Develop and maintain project documentation, including project plans, schedules, status reports, and stakeholder communications.      2. Business Analysis:    Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, analyze, and document business requirements, ensuring alignment with project goals.    Conduct gap analysis to identify areas for process improvement and develop recommendations for enhancing operational efficiency.    Facilitate requirements workshops and meetings to elicit and prioritize stakeholder needs.    Translate business requirements into functional specifications and user stories, ensuring clear communication to development teams.      3. Stakeholder Management:    Engage with internal and external stakeholders to build strong relationships and manage expectations throughout the project lifecycle.    Communicate project updates, risks, and issues to stakeholders, ensuring timely and effective communication.    Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, testers, and subject matter experts, to ensure successful project delivery.    Conduct user acceptance testing (UAT) in coordination with stakeholders to validate solutions against business requirements.      4. Quality Assurance:    Conduct regular project reviews to ensure compliance with established quality standards.    Implement quality assurance processes to identify and resolve issues, ensuring project deliverables meet the desired level of quality.    Monitor project performance metrics and KPIs to measure project success and identify areas for improvement.      5. Continuous Improvement:    Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in project management and business analysis.    Identify opportunities for process improvement and propose innovative solutions to enhance project delivery and efficiency.    Actively contribute to organizational knowledge management by documenting lessons learned and sharing best practices.        Qualifications and Skills:          Bachelor s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field (Master s degree preferred).      Proven experience as a Project Manager or Business Analyst, preferably in a technology-driven environment.      Strong understanding of project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Scrum, Waterfall) and business analysis techniques.      Proficient in project management tools and software, such as JIRA, Trello, or Microsoft Project.      Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.      Exceptional verbal and written communication abilities, with the capacity to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels.      Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.      Collaborative team player with the capacity to work independently and lead multidisciplinary teams.      Relevant certifications (e.g., PMP      , CBAP) are highly desirable.
